description: Frequentative of Middle English striden (whence modern English stride), from Old English strīdan, from Proto-West Germanic *strīdan, from Proto-Germanic *strīdaną. Equivalent to stride +‎ -le (frequentative suffix).

verbs.description: striddle (third-person singular simple present striddles, present participle striddling, simple past and past participle striddled)

entries.meaning: (dialectal, Scotland, Northern England) To straddle. [from mid-15th c.]
examples: I'm going along like a lame duck striddling a gutter.
